body.p:
Danville December 25th 1860
To his Excellency
Beriah Magoffin
Dear Sir

on the 24th day of this month a young man from Tennesee Named (Joshua Flowers) was attacked by a Low character upon the Street here, and was in great danger of bodily harm when his Brother a Youth of about 15 years of age went to his rescue & Struck the man with a rock for which he the Brother (Pinckney Flowers) was fined five Dollars ($500) & cost, which amount I write to you for the ^purpose^ of getting it remitted -- these young Men are both poor, honest & industrious and are working here by the day to Earn Enough to Enable there Widowd Mother & orphan children, to get a Support they are en Strangers in this community having been here but a short while but all who know them would testify to there Soberness & correctness of character hoping you will see the Justice of the request I am Yours Respectfully

N B
I did do not think it worth while to send you a petition with a number of Signatures which could Easily be obtained but will refer you to for the truth of any statement I might make the Sheriff of
Boyle County or M. J. Durham Esqr
Wm C Anderson
J F Bell
Clifton Rodes Sr or any prominent citizen of, Danville

Danvile Po. ct
$5. } breach
P. Flower
Respd 6 mo.
Issd Jany 14 1861

Flowers case
Danville
